author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Neyveli Lignite Corporation (NLC) has launched a campaign to raise awareness of the importance of voting and maximise voter participation in Neyveli constituency in the upcoming Assembly elections.

S.K. Acharya, CMD NLC, inaugurated the distribution of printed handbills with the awareness message to voters at Neyveli Villudayan Pattu Subramaniya Swamy Thirukovil during the celebrations of ‘Panguni Uthiram’ festival.

Neyveli Township, considered an important part of the Neyveli Legislative Assembly Constituency, consists of around 71,000 registered voters. This includes the employees of Corporation and their family members and all of them are literates. The date of election has been declared a holiday.

NLC is also co-ordinating with the Election Commission and State government machineries to ensure 100 per cent voting. Recently an exclusive office with necessary infrastructure was inaugurated at Neyveli Township for the booth level officers. The launch of the campaign was timed with the ‘Panguni Uthiram’ festival which is thronged by thousands of devotees.

Yoga Maya Acharya, President, Neyveli Ladies Club, Dinesh, the Election Officer for Neyveli Constituency and Mohan, Deputy Election Officer participated.
title: NLC campaign to maximise voting
